title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1627-2.11 - Tenant's refusal to cooperate in income determination
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1627-2.11 - Tenant's refusal to cooperate in income determination

State Regulations

The failure, neglect or refusal of a tenant to furnish
information concerning his income or that of any member of his household, or to
cooperate in the verifying of such reported income will be considered as
non-cooperation and will be assumed to indicate excess income. Such tenant will
be notified of his ineligibility, increased to the vacating rent, and legal
action taken to obtain his eviction as not complying with the rules and
regulations of the authority. However, upon submission of proper documents, surcharges, if any, will be assessed on basis of verified income. In no event
will credit be given for excess surcharges already assessed as a result of
failure, neglect or refusal of tenant to cooperate in income determination as
set forth in this section. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
1627-2.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
